title: How to Apply Resin to a  Table

steps.headline: Get a 2" to 3" scraper and a brush.
Get resin.
steps.description: Most resins are comprised of two compounds that you mix right before application.

steps.headline: Prepare.The surface to be treated by cleaning it and removing all lint and dust.
Make sure your surface is level.
Prepare for some run off on the edges, by laying newspaper or cardboard underneath!
Open (or mix) .Open or mix per instructions, do not shake (as it adds bubbles)
If using a mix, pour over center of surface and spread with scraper, don't worry about marks or pattern, it automatically levels out.
If using a pre-mix.
steps.description: Dip brush in resin and brush from center to the outside.

steps.headline: When done, leave it  close, you'll have drip and run off that will need to be cleaned or wiped up.

text: Get a 2" to 3" scraper and a brush.  Get resin. Most resins are comprised of two compounds that you mix right before application. Prepare.The surface to be treated by cleaning it and removing all lint and dust.  Make sure your surface is level.  Prepare for some run off on the edges, by laying newspaper or cardboard underneath!  Open (or mix) .Open or mix per instructions, do not shake (as it adds bubbles)  If using a mix, pour over center of surface and spread with scraper, don't worry about marks or pattern, it automatically levels out.  If using a pre-mix. Dip brush in resin and brush from center to the outside. When done, leave it  close, you'll have drip and run off that will need to be cleaned or wiped up.
